longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 3 months from the arrival date. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a National ID Card issued to nationals of France.

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 6 weeks:
 - for nationals of France (except those holding passports
   issued by New Caledonia, Reunion, St Pierre and Miquelon or
   Wallis and Futuna Islands).
Visa required, except for A max. stay of 14 days for nationals
of France holding a National ID Card. Extension of stay is not
possible. 
Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Nationals of France who are
residents of New Caledonia, Reunion, St Pierre and Miquelon or
Wallis and Futuna Islands can obtain a visa on arrival, for a
max. stay of 6 weeks. Fee: XCD 200.-. Extension of 1 month is
possible.
Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of New Caledonia will be
  expected to hold their own passport or National ID Card
  (where applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia,
  Cyprus, Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay and documents required for their next
  destination.
- Extensions of stay possible, by applying at the main
  Immigration office in Castries.
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward ticket could be refused
  entry.



 St
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 1 year of age.
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission provided not leaving the transit areas.
